Content:
All other things being equal, does a parallel twin have any advantages or disadvantages compared to a V-twin of the same displacement?

All I can think of is a v-configuration can make for a slimmer bike,

but a parallel twin arrangement should be better for air-cooled engines because the windstream will hit both the left and right cylinder heads equally.

What other factors are in play here,
that I have not considered?
